channel.title: Why I don't respond to feedback
channel.description:
I figured I'd say why I don't really respond to feedback lately.
No matter what I say, people will rush to just try to prove me wrong.
I don't exactly have time nor do I want to deal with that constantly.
Like the reason that Possess was reduced was because I believe 17%+ win rate for a NK is way too high, but people will jump at the opportunity to tell me that my opinion on what the win rates should be is wrong.
The reason the neuts were changed was because people kept saying they wanted them to be more neutral, so that's what I tried to do. Then when I explained that to people, they tell me that they never saw anyone complaining about it, so I must be wrong.
I literally can't say anything without someone arguing with me. It gets old quickly.

item.title: Why I don't respond to feedback
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Marcus_Doodalee:

Smite already does this, stops converts on the paladin

Fire means that it should only prevent conversions. Killing the CL on top of preventing conversions is too strong

Read full topic
item.source: Why I don't respond to feedback

item.title: Why I don't respond to feedback
item.dc:creator: Marcus_Doodalee
item.description:
Firelitten:

How about making smite stop converts on two people

Smite already does this, stops converts on the paladin and someone else, I’d be happy if it was a double conversion protect that could target any 2 people except the paladin, then CWs are hella important for protecting the paladin

Firelitten:

it 100% is on a BD class. Trust me.

PGOs in TOS LUL

Yeah I’d be happy with 15% being a maximum for NK. Any more than that consistently is cause for concern. I think most people agreed that mind control was the main reason why possessor has a higher winrate

Read full topic
item.source: Why I don't respond to feedback

item.title: Why I don't respond to feedback
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
I made the same suggestion in the mentioned thread. I am hypothesizing that Boslof saw it as soon afterwards Smite was altered, so he preferred the different option. I do think Boslof’s direction is more fun for the Paladin in question.

Read full topic

item.title: Why I don't respond to feedback
item.dc:creator: Firekitten
item.description:
Honestly killing all visitors already is a bad town Ability, besides the fact that you are probably using it on someone you Town read, it causes other people like the physician to target them as well.

Also killing 4 BD in one night is a thing

Read full topic

item.title: Why I don't respond to feedback
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
I agree with firekitten on this, it should just prevent conversion(and remove the warmup period. The warmup time was added because the cult is at a huge loss if the paladin yolo smites early). Killing the CL as well is too strong
